page.title: 14Malmesbury Coarse Fishing
page.content: Hatches and weirs around{Malmesbury control the water level from flooding the houses.There are 5 old water mills,3 on the Avon,2 on the Ingleburn.At St Johns street the river Ingleburn flows into the Avon. Underneath{Malmesbury}are chalk streams. When the Wessex Water Authority turns on the pumps the water level drops as the river feeds the streams.There are several species of fish,Pike,Perch,Dace,Trout,Roach, Minnows,Chub and Barbel.To fish at most places in{Malmesbury}you need to join Bristol and District Amalgamated Anglers{(B.D.A.A.)}but at the station yard and recreation field it is free fishing.Employees of{PYE TMC}can join the Sports Club and fish between the { {Somerford Fishing Association}waters and the{B.D.A.A.}waters.
